I was hesitant to eat here at first because it looked like just another typical Americanized Mexican fast food restaurant, but the food is much more interesting than the name implies.   The burritos here are huge and very filling, and they seem to be closer to the traditional San Francisco Mission style than the generic Chipotle style. They have unusual (to me) toppings like al pastor, pickled onions, French fries, and a very spicy hot sauce. I usually stick with the al pastor, but last time I tried the wet burrito, which was even better. I only tried the tacos once, and was not impressed.

I can't say enough good things about this place! They're so friendly, the food is good, reasonably priced and super fresh ingredients. They don't go light on meat or toppings like most places do! We are now regulars!

The prices are really reasonable.  The 90.5 rating by the health department was concerning.  The service was slooooooooooow.   The most important part is the food though.... and it was good enough to go back again.  I had the California wet burrito - which means it has cheese sauce and French fries on it as well as your choice of protein.  It was filling and I left happy.    My biggest complaint is that the French fries weren't crisp - they had sat for too long on the fryer.

I have been to burrito factory for taco Tuesday and it has yet to disappoint. 99 cent tacos!!!! Where else in Charlotte can you get this cheap of tacos? Let me know because I'd love to find the competitor and see if it even comes close to competing with burrito factory.   Be aware, Tuesday's do tend to get busy. There may be a long line but they are very time efficient and it usually goes pretty fast. It's set up like a taco buffet, two things I cannot resist! They have every topping you can think of and the choice of chicken, spicy chicken, pork, or beef-all delicious. Your tacos come with chips so no need to order extra! The size of the tacos may seem small,  but don't be fooled, once you have the toppings and chips, you will be more than satisfied! I have not tried anything other than the taco Tuesday deal but the whole menu looks really good and definitely worth trying!   The staff are sooo friendly, especially the first guy you hit who asks how many tacos you want. He is constantly smiling and can't help but put a smile on your face too.   Burrito factory is a little bit down south boulevard but worth the trip!!

yesterday was my first time coming to the burrito factory and i am so glad i did. it was taco tuesday with .99 cents taco. Everything was extremely fresh and the staff was friendly. I will definitely have to come earlier because they ran out of a few items but i did come 30 mins before close. cant wait till next tuesday

I've driven by this place a bunch of times and always resolved to try it, but didn't get the chance until yesterday.  I actually checked its reviews on Yelp which helped solidify my decision to check it out after a long and painful meeting at my credit union.  Anyway, I got the chicken curry burrito and a fish taco, and my girlfriend got two veggie tacos and an order of fried plaintains.  I got a normal fountain drink and she got horchata which I took a sip of and it was quite tasty.  My burrito was excellent.  They have a ton of options to add, so I tried pickled red onions, hot salsa, shredded cheese, iceberg lettuce, and diced hot peppers (not sure which kind of pepper, coloring seemed like a mix of jalapenos and Thai chiles) to go along with the curry chicken, black beans, and (delicious) seasoned rice that came standard.  On the fish taco I got some more of the diced hot peppers, raw red onion, hot salsa, corn, and diced cucumber.  Both the burrito and the taco were delicious.  I was shocked that I actually even preferred the taco, which surprised me because it contained tilapia, which is a relatively bland fish, but everything else I added worked perfectly with the well-cooked, tender fish.  The burrito was also excellent but I ate the taco first and had a hard time finishing it because it's very large - think Qdoba-sized.  I really appreciated how they briefly pressed it in the tortilla steamer which helped keep it coherent and added a slight bit of crispness.  Their prices are very reasonable and we will certainly be back.  The only thing that detracted from the experience (but not so much as to knock it down from a 5-star rating) was the ordering process, which was a bit chaotic as they had two line workers handing off between helping us and preparing takeout orders so it could be a little confusing at times.  The gentleman working the register was very courteous and warmly greeted everyone who walked through the door.  Overall it was fantastic and I can't wait to get back.
Yummy! Went on a Thursday and everything on the menu was 5.99. Everyone was really nice and gave great recommendations. Get there early because the guacamole runs out! Best burritos in Charlotte!

My husband and I spent the day in Charlotte last week.  Apparently my husband had bookmarked this place.  I'm so glad he did.  It was a little scary at first.  There wasn't anyone in the parking lot, it looked desolate.  It was 11:30 and we had just beat the lunch rush.  Right after we ordered and sat down, it got busy.  They don't have anything labelled Gluten Free (GF).  When I asked, they were more than happy to accomodate.  They made me a bowl, a steak burrito without the tortilla, not on the menu.    We were fortunate to also get to meet Isaac.  He made sure we were satisfied with food and service.  Zero complaints....thanks for the great lunch!

We liked the food and the people.   We couldn't find the napkins which is hidden off to the side of the restaurant. Odd.   We enjoyed the pork burrito and veggie burrito.  I really liked that they cooked the zucchini and squash fresh in front of me. They had a variety of salsa to choose from.   We also enjoyed the like and mandarin natural sodas. The lime was better than mandarin.

This is one of the few options near our apartment (other than pizza and Chinese) that will deliver to us. We have ordered from them three times, and I still have not been impressed. The rice is not seasoned and it should be because the majority of the burrito is rice. They are very sparing with the beans and the chicken.   Last time we ordered from them (estimated wait time of 30-40 minutes) the driver called 50 minutes after placing our order to say he couldn't find the address in his GPS and was still at the restaurant. When he finally did arrive the cheese fries we had ordered were cold and the queso was congealed.
Had the California wet burrito, it was fantastic.  Fresh food, quick and very polite service.  Will be back

This place looks like a total hole in the wall, but it is really good.  Everything seemed so fresh and made to order.  The salsa varieties were excellent and quantities are large enough for two meals.

I literally signed up for Yelp just to review this place, because I was so disappointed and am hoping for answers from the establishment. The employees were very friendly - although overwhelmed, and the one salsa available at the "salsa bar" wasn't terrible. Because of the food though, this place deserves a 1.   I'd been so excited to try this place forever - I always drive by it. Today I saw a "tacos 1$ Tuesday" sign and decided it was the day. I stood in line, got my food, and the result was underwhelming to say the least. I am so saddened by the food, I don't understand how the reviews are so positive! Maybe it was an off day, I don't know.   The vegetables (pico de Gallo and corn) were fresh but not ripe enough, aka pretty tasteless. I ordered two bean and veggie tacos, and was charged full price as "veggie tacos are not part of the deal." This didn't make sense to me, considering meat is more expensive than some lettuce and corn. It would've been nice to have a note or a warning made b4 I chose that option. Just a note, because overall the employees were super friendly and made the visit almost worth it.   I also got a salad with chicken, and to my horror, apparently the only option is shredded chicken? Like the oily, putrid lunch meat shredded chicken in greasy red tasteless oil. Is there an option for grilled chicken?   Thirdly, the salsa bar was non existent.   I ended up eating my non-grilled, cold tacos out of starvation and trying to pick at lettuce from my disappointing salad. (It should be noted, the shredded chicken meat was so foul and so mixed in that the taste permeated the entire salad and I had to throw it away. I couldn't eat any of the veggies without tasting foul chicken.)  I hope to try this place again and see if it's better. At the moment though I really feel cheated out of my $.   Sorry, Burrito Factory. I wish I would've enjoyed it. I've eaten at Mexican and South American and Central American joints all over Charlotte and beyond. I love everything from Qdoba to Sabor to authentic food trucks on the side of the S Blvd. My family even owned a popular Latin restaurant here b4 selling it to retire.   So, I don't know what palette Burrito Factory is catering to, but if you tend to like authentic and tasty burritos or tacos... or yummy taco salads, this isn't the place :( .

Would you like some fries with that? Sure, why not put them in the burrito. Huh? Actually, it's a grand idea. I mean usually at a burrito place you get chips - and you do here as well - but they actually put the fries inside. Who ever thought of such nonsense? I don't know, but they are a freaking genius.  The decor at the factory is not going to win any prizes, but let's face it - you aren't here for the decor. It's all about the food. And chances are, you probably aren't here for a holiday meal anyway. As you are across the parking lot from a couple of drinking establishments, it may be after you've had a few, so you just want to stuff your pie hole, and there is absolutely nothing wrong with that.  Saunter up to the register and order your burrito, get the fries on the inside, add whatever other toppings you like and gorge yourself. One word of advice: It's better when you eat it there. Leftovers are not so tasty (many things are not in the harsh light of day). Consider yourself warned.

This place was a great for a  lunch date. The line was kinda long but understandable since the orders are made to order.  Had the California wet burrito and it was amazing. Hubby had the fish tacos and already asked when we will be back. Definitely 5 stars.

First things first- they offer a 15% discount for UNCC students with their student ID. The menu boasts quesadillas, tacos, taco salads, and burritos. I'm surprised they don't have nachos. On Tuesdays they have taco Tuesdays - tacos are 99 cents. On Thursday's all menu items are 5.49. I went here on a Monday and it was slow. I will say that I love the Mexican rice. Portions are huge as u can see from the pictures. There is more than enough to share a burrito. They have a verde and a red sauce. They are delicious. Your meal comes with chips. I wish they had a chips and salsa option on the menu. Just a warning that the ground beef is rather greasy and I think I will try the steak next time. The staff was really nice and the portions are extremely generous. I will be back for sure. Check this out next time you are in the area!

The owners were nice and the serving size was great. The best burrito is the one with the fish and plantains in it.  Make sure you get the plantains because one night, as they were assembling the large burrito, they failed to tell me they had run out until it was too late.  But they offered free queso dip.  The salsa dips on the side don't range far in variety but its enough.  It's fine since we just loaded up on the fresh condiments that come with.  For the budget-friendly, Tuesdays are $1 tacos and Thursdays have a discounted any-burrito price!  Don't mind the exterior, just come on in

Not bad. The prices are decent. I feel like my burrito could have been better. But I've only been there once so I'm not gonna give up on it. I wanna try it again. My daughter was satisfied and she doesn't eat much so that was a plus.

I went during lunch on Tuesday. They open at 11 and I got there around 11:45. There were already a good amount of people in line. The line moved at a decent pace. The food was very fresh and they have a good variety of toppings. One thing I dislike is that they don't have any salsas to add to your food. You can buy the little cups of salsa if you want for 35 cents. Guacamole is also extra (about $1.00), but it is very good. I would definitely go again. The prices are excellent!

We enjoyed our vegan burritos and the salsa bar.  I'd like to have seen the salsas marked with either ingredients or letting us know if the one was vegan friendly but it was no big deal.  It took five minutes or so for them to make our tofu but the man was extremely apologetic about it and offered us drinks and chips while we waited.  We'll be back, it was tasty!

Love this place...you have got to support this restaurant! Owner is there everyday and super awesome. He puts real pride into his business and providing the freshest ingredients. Try the tacos in every option...and the salsas have got to be some of the best around!

In a former life, I lived near Montford and I would drive past this place all the time without giving it a second thought. Thank God for Yelp. 4.5 stars strong? I had to come see what all the fuss is about.  Dollar tacos on Tuesdays? Yes please! They do beef, pork, and chicken options for the special. I went with two spicy chicken and a beef. Sidenote: the woman in front of me got a salad. Listen honey, you're doing Tuesdays wrong. I love the long laundry list of toppings you can choose from here. I can't really think of anyone else who does this. I was really impressed by the size of the tacos. At a lot of places, a Taco Tuesday special is pretty skimpy. Not here. My tacos were loaded.   Another bonus: THEY HAVE A SALSA BAR!! You know my motto, all places should have a salsa bar. Hell, I would put one in my living room if my roommate would let me. Wonder what she would do if she came home one night to find a salsa bar in place of the coffee table? My tacos came with free chips, so I was super happy to try #allthesauces.   It was pretty warm in there for lunch, but it was 103 degrees outside. Every place in Charlotte is warm right now in this heatwave. I didn't mind it a bit. I enjoyed eating my lunch alone and watching all the action in the restaurant. All the workers were really nice. There was a pretty steady stream of people coming in and out for lunch.   I don't live near here anymore, but I will definitely be coming back. It's well worth the drive. My only regret is that I never gave this place a chance sooner. However, that may be a good thing or else I would weigh 300 pounds.  Kudos, Burrito Factory. I really dig what you guys are doing here.

I live near The Burrito Factory and naturally I stopped in for Taco Tuesday to grab some dollar tacos and they were great! I always get spicy chicken tacos which are nicely favored, the topping are fresh. The staff is very friendly.    Bonus: The Salsa bar with great tasting salsa and other sauces for the tacos.   You can't go wrong with Dollar Spicy Chicken tacos and a Pineapple Jarritos.

I came on a Sunday afternoon and the employees were very friendly. My burrito was prepared quickly and it was quite huge and delicious and not pricey.Great addition for food choice in the area and I definitely will be back.
Taco Tuesday is clutch..99 cent tacos...very fresh...nachos and salsa all great
I had the burrito al pastor.  Disappointing, as it's 95% rice.  Also, I didn't care for the pork, what there was of it, seriously loose the pineapple.

Delicious! Well flavored, huge portion - it was great! Im not sure exactly which one I had, my husband picked it up for me and said he got me the Choriqueso Burrito but it had shredded pork or something in it instead of the ground beef, so I dont really know what I had. I didn't taste the queso in it but my husband insists he watched them put it in it. But they filled it up with lots of toppings. Took me 2 hands to eat it - my husband ended up with some of it, huge burrito! The queso dip was my fave, it had a little spice/flavor, not really spicy, but it had a little something that made it pretty great. I tend to like light, flaky chips and these were just your normal chips like everywhere so not my fave but they were all I needed to devour the queso dip! Lots of salsa options too. I would go here over Chipotle anyday!

Really  good... I like the freshly stewed meats for the burritos, u won't leave there hungry. People were nice and the bar had great sauces and limes cut in halves .. I'll be back, thanks Burrito Factory. I like the choice of the pineapple juice in the fountain drink area. I got the carne fresh off the stove , girlfriend got the pastor stewed pork and it was really tasty.

First off let me say that this is a perfect location for a restaurant such as this one. Located on North Tryon St. behind UNC Charlotte, this Tex Mex gem is a must visit.   Their meat options are full of flavor and the toppings are fresh. I get a bit overwhelmed just thinking about the flavor profiles and the different combinations that can be created when they are putting together your tacos or burrito. They also have a house made salsa, as well as a tomatillo and guaillo sauce. I personally love the guaillo one. It's got a nice kick to it, and goes great on the side or in your dish of choice. All of their tacos, burritos, and quesadillas come with chips on the side.  The workers there are very nice. This location has only been open about a month, but I must say the management did a great job with training their staff.  Overall, I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a unique Tex-Mex experience.

Its nothing amazing. The only amazing thing about this place is that each time I wanted to eat there, they were close and that made this place to be saved under my bookmarks. I tried it and...meh! When you are in this part of town, I suggest you go to another Mexican place to eat. The prices are OK, the food is OK, the service is wonderful, the environment not the greatest to look at. So, yeah..pretty much not a charmer. However, I am still interested to see how the $1 Taco night are. So, I will be returning on a Tuesday night and maybe I might change my mind and add or possibly even reduce the rating by a star. But one thing is clear, the owners or if they are not the owners and rather workers, are def. trying their best and are super friendly.

Meh.  I was excited to try this place but came away disappointed. I had the California Wet Burrito and found it to be on the bland side. Service was quick, burritos were huge and well-made, I just wasn't feeling the flavors. For what it's worth, my fiance enjoyed his burrito.  With all the rave reviews, I'll probably give this place another shot someday.

Very solid burritos here. I usually get a burrito bowl it is a really huge portion especially if you opt for the bowl variety.  Do your self a favor if you like shrimp try the chipotle shrimp burrito.  It is the absolute truth..

Seriously amazing food!  The burritos are huge and so flavorful.  The chicken juice burritos with chipotle chicken are off the chain.  Tried the fish tacos, omg delicous!  Fresh talapia, with pico, lettuce, and cheese.  Great daily specials so you can try something new each time you visit.  The staff is always super friendly.  One of my favorite spots if Ian heading to or from uptown on south Blvd.
Cucumber in the Pico is what gets me. Also, if your sign says all menu items are x price, don't wait and tell us it's only chicken and beef when paying.

Hello Friends,   The Burrito Factory is a South Side Staple in the community. Great service. Fast Service. Good quality toppings, meats, chips, etc. The last i was there they had a sign saying "We apologize for the inconvenience but we are installing a new AC unit". It was hot as heck in there and it was still people dining in and ordering take out. Food MUST be good for people to take that kinda heat inside a building.   Tuesday is 99 cent day Thursday is One Price day $7.49 (I believe)   The different sauce that you can get with your meal are great. From mild to hot. I like this place, you go for yourself and i think you will as well.   Go Enjoy,  TTFN

Absolutely amazing! I LOVE Mexican food & this was a pleasant surprise of a find! So many fresh toppings to choose from. Seafood items are cooked to order and the flavors are amazing! Also the prices are great. Taco Tuesday boasts 99¢ tacos & $5.49 burritos on Thursdays. I absolutely recommend! I've already been 3x!
Great experience for a simple burrito spot. Great service, excellent food, & nice salsa bar.

I had a craving for a chicken burrito so we yelped (lol) a spot. We read good reviews so we decided to give this place a chance. OMG! The food was delicious. The burrito was so big we couldn't eat it in one sitting. We will definitely go back.

We love coming here, the food is delicious and the staff are all friendly. we aren't vegetarian but we always order the veggie burrito. It comes with freshly cooked squash and kale and it's so yummy. What I love about this place over a Chipotle or something is the toppings. Feta, pickled onions, olives, etc. you can really make a yummy unique burrito. Also really love their guajillos salsa. They have a very spicy version behind the bar as well as the mild one they serve on the side with chips. Its the best thing about this place!

I love this place. It's better than most of the chain burrito places and has some ingredients you won't find just anywhere. The guy behind the counter was a bit chatty but he ended up giving us some free authentic soup I would've never known about had he not talke

Being a So Cal native now living in Charlotte I can confirm that this really is California style Mexican food. Everything is fresh and made from scratch. If you are looking for Chipotle or Salsaritas  - then go there, this is what a real Mexican burrito tastes like! Now - if only Charlotte had a beach...

I got the "wet" burrito from there. It was terrible. Also the first time I had French fries on a burrito. The salsa bar.....only one kind had any flavor whatsoever. The Pico de Gallo was basically chopped vegetables, no lime juice or even salt. Will not be back.

Great food love Taco Tuesdays. However the last time I went I ordered plantains. I was so excited to eat them. Once I got home I noticed they were so burnt. Tried to mask the taste but ended up throwing them away. A waste of $4. So I definitely will open my food up there before I leave. Made a great food taste horrible.
OMG! The burritos are huge and delicious. Excellent tacos too. Their guajillo salsa is excellent on the al pastor burrito. Their beef burrito is super savory. All around awesome.

I've had this place bookmarked for awhile so on a recent cheat night, we went here for a quick dinner. It's definitely not fancy inside but it was pretty clean, which is the first thing I look for. When we walked in, we were immediately greeted by super friendly and helpful staff who helped me with recommendations. I opted for the California Wet Burrito with chicken. The portion was huge and I couldn't finish it all. Definitely a great bang for your buck. The only two things that kept this from being five stars were the chips (kinda stale to me) and the mini-cup I was given when I ordered water (this is a personal pet peeve of mine -why can't I get the same size cup for my water that others get for soda?).   Overall, this was a solid spot and we will be back.

Let me tell you about the Burrito Factory:   It's clean, the food is fresh, the workers are very nice, they have a television inside, there's a salsa bar, the nacho chips are yummy, they have a cooler full of Jarritos and the Coca-Cola made with cane sugar (it's better than our stuff), they deliver, there's space inside to eat as well, their beans and rice will make you want to throw something because they're just that good, they have daily specials...   Most importantly, you will never be disappointed. Seriously. Just go.

Oh, how I wish Chip Nutty had worked out (http://www.yelp.com/biz/chip-nutty-cookies-charlotte), but alas, it wasn't in the cards. Instead we get The Burrito Factory. I usually select local, one-store, type businesses over the chain ones for two reasons, to support local business and because they are usually fresher, better and made with more love than those chain factories.  Unfortunately, The Burrito Factory didn't have that local feeling I was looking for. Now, their food is NOT bad by any stretch of the imagination. But there really wasn't any real flavor or soul to speak of. My burrito was very bland despite the fact that I added nearly everything they had to offer. My mother ordered a couple of tamales and they literally just plop two tamales on a place and put some weird cheese-base sauce over them. Nothing else... That's not how you serve tamales.  The day we went they had a local Latin radio station truck outside, which is how we noticed the place and decided to stop. Unfortunately, aside from what looked like an excessive number of servers and what I think was one of the owners and his buddies, there was nobody there but us.   Their menu is simple and has some good offers. One of the cool features is their salsa bar, which has some very unique salsas you usually don't see anywhere else.  Not a bad place to eat, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

If I don't come here for Taco Tuesday, my whole week is shot. The California style  burritos and tacos, the fresh salsas, and the aguas frescas keep me coming back at least once a week. It's delicious, fast, and cheap, with friendly staff who will remember your order if you're a regular, even though the place does a lot of business.

The place is amazing and one of my go to spots for lunch during the work week. The food is fresh the staff is nice but you better get there early before the lunch time rush.   They offer taco specials daily, burritos, salads, quesadillas, and a nice kids menu. You have options in meat but also tofu which is great. The pricing is amazing for the amount of food you get most expensive is approximately $9 and trust me you will be full to the brim.

Save yourself the trip and go to Chipoltle or even Taco Bell! This place is way overcrowded and not worth the wait. I ordered 6 tacos on taco Tuesday and my date had a steak burrito. I had 2 of each (chicken, pork, and ground beef) and the chicken was good beef was ok and the pork was inedible. The salsa bar was nice but not enough chips. My dates burrito was overlooked for steak. Also just for sour cream is an extra .50 cent! Most places don't charge extra for that!! Will not return due to price and quality. Overall bad experience with some below average food. Next time will get a quesorita at Taco Bell and save 10$!

I absolutely love this place! The owners and staff are very nice and the food is outrageously delicious! All the ingredients are fresh, like just chopped kinda freshness! The burritos are MASSIVE! So delicious. Just get here, and quickly.
My first time visting. pleasantly surprised. Will try again. Burrito good. Place was clean and prices reasonable. Got the steak burrito lunch special and came tortilla chips and sauce bar. Yum.

My girlfriend and I just recently moved here from the west coast and have been searching for burritos like home! Factory burrito has the best burritos in the whole Charlotte area! Sam, the owner stayed open an extra 30minutes just so we could get from Concord to Charlotte an enjoy burritos for dinner. Amazing owner, amazing staff, an amazing food!! My girlfriend and I recommend the wet California burrito you can not go wrong! Thank you Sam we will see you again soon!!!!
Had the chicken curry burrito.  Very bland flavor.  Ingredients was definitely fresh and salsa bar was very good.

Love this place. It is right next to my house so we frequent regularly. Highly recommend the Beef tacos (not a beef person, but these beef tacos are unreal). They also do a great job keeping the food fresh and letting you add whatever/and as many toppings you want at no additional charge. Taco Tuesday is an awesome deal - we had 6 tacos with guac and were out of there paying around $10 total. great service, convenient salsa bar and awesome food!
Not actually open till 9 pm on Sunday's. The sign on the door says otherwise but I was informed by an employee that they in fact close at 6pm on Sunday's.

Nope, not a dancing burrito but "The Burrito Fatory"  will leave you dancing out of the establishment. This place stands out on South Blvd where there is a surplus of Tex-Mex and California style food establishments. This is a usual quick lunch spot for me. On Tuesdays they have 99 cent tacos and they have a massive burrito which will rival any Moe's or Qudoba burrito. Unlike chain restaurants The Burrito Factory actually sells fish and tofu, plus different types of tortillas. The salsa bar here is 2nd to none in Charlotte, The downfall about The Burrito Factory is that their chips are harder than what I'm sure anyone is use to, though they may pile them up with whatever you order they should really work on that recipe.  The Manager/Owner is very cool and hip to what's going on. Overall if your looking for a Big Ass Burrito at a great price and your on the South side of Charlotte you have to stop by The Burrito Factory.

So, The Burrito Factory is located on South Blvd. and can be missed if you are not paying attention. Although the outside is somewhat blah, the interior is clean and designed with a somewhat trendy feel & TV for your enjoyment. Upon arrival, we were a little confused at the layout, where to order (being the only ones there), but was questioned by the cook  who stepped out behind the counter. We ordered one chicken burrito & one chicken quesadilla w/ chips & guacamole. Being there is only one cook, things do move a little slow, but everything is fresh & you select you additional items from behind the counter, that included cheese, lettuce, jalapeños, onions, etc. We paid and hit the salsa bar, which offered a variety of flavors. Although others Yelpers enjoyed, we thought some were a little too hot, too bland, etc. nothing seemed to hit the perfect mark. And, the soda machine offered no ice, so the owner/manger took our cups to the back to fill with ice, strange.  However, the food & chips arrived fresh, hot and were delicious. The chicken burrito had rice & beans, along with the additions and was great. The chicken quesadilla was just as good. Both fresh chicken, great rice & beans! I did enjoy the guacamole, but do wish I enjoyed the salsa as much.   I would love to give them a 3.5, but that is not an option. I will be back, knowing how things work, but recommend to those first timers, don't be in a rush & try everything..

Better than chipotle! The chicken is juicy and flavorful. Large portions and fresh selection options. Staff very nice and it's affordable! Got a huge burrito chips and salsa and a large drink for 10$!!

Had for lunch in Friday for the first time. Delivered to our business. Late then forgot one of my colleagues' salads. When we called to ask that they bring it, they didn't even consider it and instead just said they would refund the money for the salad. Not acceptable.   The food was okay. The chicken burrito is undoubtedly one of the biggest I've eaten. But it was pretty dry and was mostly filled with rice - which I like but is not what I want my chicken burrito filled up with. The chips were good and my colleagues were all relatively happy with their food too. But not enough to worry about ordering there again.

I am a big chipotle fan, and this place is better! Better service, clean place and the food is so fresh and delicious. You can taste each flavor and ingredient. The avocado, the unique cali style burritos, the quesadilla, fantastic. I highly recommend this place for lunches. And it's even cheaper than chipotle!

A local spin off Chipotle, this place was fast and delicious!  We ordered the Nachos and California Style Fish burrito to split. I have to admit this was my first fish burrito and I loved every bite of it. It had grilled tilapia, plantains, cheese, jalapenos and guacamole. Made to order. I put a little bit of everything on the nachos with extra cheese sauce. We were stuffed before we could finish our meals.  Best part of Burrito Factory is their sauces/salsas. All meals seem to come with their signature medium sauce. I upped the ante and got their habanero salsa (a must if you love spicy). Great spot for lunch, not too far off the beaten path from Southend. We'll be back!

New favorite lunch location. Sam is great and willing to do whatever it takes for his costumer to love the experience. Chips are pretty good, could be a little warmer. Very friendly staff. Very fresh and healthy burrito toppings.   I usually get the burrito on special or .99 cent tacos on Tuesday. Love this place!

Along the stretch of road that we Charlotteans call "Burrito Way" is of course, the Burrito Factory (which shall be referenced as BF). A shining star in a desert of Central American "burrito special with rice and beans for $5.95" restaurants.  A bit like the Californian burrito joints that have gone mainstream like Chipotle and Moe's, BF has a menu board of various meats and recipes already put together, but this is America and if you want to add or remove, you go right ahead.  I opted for the Curry Chicken Burrito and asked for extra tomatoes and onions. It was extremely tasty. For my wife, I got their veggie burrito with extra cilantro and she absolutely loved it.  Chips were great - maybe a little thicker than I like. Salsa bar was decent. The pico de gallo was really great - not hot at all. Yum.  I wish this place every success!

We stopped by The Burrito Factory for lunch based on all the reviews we read. I got one each of the fish, chicken, & steak tacos. The fish tacos aren't part of the Taco Tuesday deal, but I still wanted to try it. I have to say it was my favorite. The spicy chicken was not spicy at all. The steak taco wasn't as flavorful as I would have expected & had a strong flavor of I believe cilantro (but I could be wrong in that). I topped my tacos with guacamole, pico de gallo, & sour cream. I did like the green & orange sauces I received to go on the tacos. All of the staff were friendly and there was no wait time. I'm giving 4 stars because although not as flavorful as I expected the tacos weren't terrible and I would return to try out one of the burritos.
Probably 3.5 stars but hey what with the great service I had, in the really really fresh salsa ingredients I rounded up to 4.
This place is very wonderful , you can select from various choice from the menu ,I only tried few items on the menu and so far I had great meals.they have specials on Tuesday and Thursday.

Part of me wants to keep this place a secret but it wouldn't be right to hide it from the public. These are the best burritos in town and possibly one of the best burritos I have ever had. Try the carnitas. They also have great specials. Clean, nice staff, burritos made with love.
I absolutely love Burrito Factory, especially the shrimp burrito.  Service is great and the staff are extremely pleasant!
Not great but ok. 90 on their food service score. Service was super slow. The guys working seemed very nice and friendly just took forever to get through the line. Food was not worth the wait

Finally got to try the Burrito Factory for the first time the other day.... I see why people rave about it now.  For a [Taco] Tuesday, they had a steady flow of customers, but never really a huge line out the door, unlike some other (cough, cough) places.  99 cent tacos only applies to chicken, pork, or beef tacos, but I had a regular priced fish taco that was super tasty.  Also tried the chorizo queso dip with chips... I can probably eat through a bucket of that stuff and die a happy person.... just don't open up the coffin anytime soon...  The restaurant itself is nothing glitzy... the focus is on tasty food that only sticks around a little bit cause people keep consuming it so fast.  I want to say the place has the bones of a Long John Silvers or Captain D's... but they've painted away the blue and white with black and gray.  A few tables can be pushed together to accommodate large groups, but probably only 1 or 2 large groups.  I noticed some extra chairs stacked on the side, so it's a bit of a free for all in the dining area.    The staffers are super nice and want to make sure you have the best experience possible. We got there at 8pm... and totally forgot it closed at 9pm.  They didn't rush us out or anything... so we only really "got it" when we were the last ones there after a mass exodus to the doors.  I'm sure they were tired from all the tacos they had been slinging all day long....  I need to come back and try other stuff on their menu... what I tasted so far was really great.

Awesome burritos!  I've been looking for a local alternative to Chipotle and found it in The Burrito Factory.  This is not a fancy place but a place that serves good food dosn't have to be fancy or trendy. You start off like any build to order place...starying at the menu. They have burritos and other options but the thing to get here is the burrito. I've had the chicken and choriqueso with my choice of other ingredients. Both ended up being the most flavorful burritos I've had.  Their proteins are seasoned well and their hot salsa is killer!   Top that off with a friendly staff and decent prices and you have a winner.  This is now my go to burrito place in Charlotte. Forget Chipotle!

it's honestly the best. I come every week. I don't understand how anyone isn't obsessed. The staff is so sweet. I'm always happy to wait in line on crazy days. I've had days where I went for lunch, got home and craved it for dinner. Their fried plantains are the best around.
I got the shrimp burrito and it was better than anything I have had. You must try this place if your in town or make it a destination
Had to write a few notes.  This place is great.  Its a rarity to always have a good experience somewhere.  Great food, great service, excellent staff. All in all a great restaurant.
Hands down the best burrito in Charlotte. The spicy chicken burrito is my favorite. Make sure you try their homemade sauces, the green one + the orange one = heaven.

99¢ Taco Tuesday!! Do I seriously need to say any more?! You're right... I should!   I arrived around 12pm having never eaten nor heard of this place (I know, I know) and the line wasn't that bad. It did get longer around 12:15-12:20p so I got extremely lucky. The employees were pleasant and served everyone as quickly as possible without making you feel rushed to choose the variety of toppings.   I ordered three tacos (2 spicy chicken, 1 beef) and I was pleased to learn that I was supplied with a nice amount of meat on all three. I also appreciated that the meat remained covered until someone wanted it (it's the little things, that make my tummy smile).   The food was good and filling. The only missing was a side of salsa for the chops that came with it. I will definitely be returning to try a burrito in the [near] future.

First burrito and taco spot we've been to in CLT. They offer a Cali menu of options, that gave us the excitement to go since I grew up in CA, been in TX. So hubby and I wanted to check it. We are always on the hunt for amazing food. Ordered the Cali burrito which was good, steak taco and fish tacos which weren't so great, just wish they weren't frozen. I'll stick to the steak.  May return if we're in the area and feel like having tacos and burritos. Service was ok.

The food here is delicious! Always on the lookout for a good shrimp burrito my partner suggested we stop here before heading back to Atlanta. We both grew up in the West/Southwest and know what Mexican food should taste like.   She loved her shrimp burrito! She was still talking about it when we drove away. The secret ingredient seems to be their yummy chipotle sauce.   I'm a vegetarian so I was glad they had the tofu burrito. The rice in my burrito was perfect! It took me back to the days when I would sit at my neighbor's table and she would say "Here mijita, have some rice". Like home cookin. Yum!  Also, the creamy red salsa and creamy green salsa are on point!   I had one of those Jarrito (pineapple) sodas I used to love way back when and I was in heaven. Our meals were tasty and filling at a fair price.    The restaurant was humble but clean (the women's restroom was tidy). The service was excellent. It's clear that they take pride in their food.    I highly recommend this place.

Finally got around to trying this place but wasn't very impressed. I got a shrimp burrito & the hubby had a steak burrito. Both were pretty bland. They need to add more seasoning to the food. Chips and salsa were good. The customer service is superb, very nice staff. I may try this place again but not in the immediate  future.

We HAD to check this place out after we saw the amazing reviews. We all loved everything!!  Burritos, tacos.....  And the salsa bar!!?!  Perfect. I love the variety of drinks. My kids LOVE the horchata!!  The people that were working there were very kind, and offered fantastic suggestions. The whole place was really clean, and we enjoyed the atmosphere. We will definitely be back.
